    #Differential Geometry
    2005

    Let f:X→Yf: X \rightarrow Yf:X→Y be a smooth map between manifolds without boundary.

    (i) Define what is meant by a critical point, critical value and regular value of fff.

    (ii) Show that if yyy is a regular value of fff and dim⁡X⩾dim⁡Y\operatorname{dim} X \geqslant \operatorname{dim} YdimX⩾dimY, then the set f−1(y)f^{-1}(y)f−1(y) is a submanifold of XXX with dim⁡f−1(y)=dim⁡X−dim⁡Y\operatorname{dim} f^{-1}(y)=\operatorname{dim} X-\operatorname{dim} Ydimf−1(y)=dimX−dimY.

    [You may assume the inverse function theorem.]

    (iii) Let SL(n,R)S L(n, \mathbb{R})SL(n,R) be the group of all n×nn \times nn×n real matrices with determinant 1. Prove that SL(n,R)S L(n, \mathbb{R})SL(n,R) is a submanifold of the set of all n×nn \times nn×n real matrices. Find the tangent space to SL(n,R)S L(n, \mathbb{R})SL(n,R) at the identity matrix.
